parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
An Israelite, one of the chosen people of Israel, a Jew. From Israel; an 'Israelite', i.e. Descendant of Israel.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To come to the rescue of, come to help, help. From boethos; to aid or relieve.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Everywhere, in all places. Genitive case of a presumed derivative of pas; universally.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
This; he, she, it.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lead in, bring in, introduce. From eis and ago; to introduce.
From Hellas; a Hellen or inhabitant of Hellas; by extension a Greek-speaking person, especially a non-Jew.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make unclean, pollute, desecrate, mid: I regard (treat) as unclean. From koinos; to make profane.
This; he, she, it.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
